result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kari L Reed

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Defendant - case has been Dismissed.

Cases 15CM365 and 15CT447 called together at 10:03am [mo]
Defendant Kari L Reed in court with Attorney Michael a Verrilli.  ADA Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Case 15CT447, Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint Recommendation of the Parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 15CT447, Count #2 and Case 15CM365
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Case 15CT447, Count #1 , the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 1/2 year, with conditions:

--to serve 15 days in the Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT work-release privileges, to commence on  3/11 /16 at  6:00 am. (Upon inquiry of Atty. Verrilli, the Court authorizes early report to jail so long as it is pre-arranged with the jail)
--to maintain absolute sobriety (no possession or consumption of alcohol, no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Driver's License and Agent approval
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to pay fine of $450 plus costs
--to pay blood testing fees to Fort PD in the amount of $59.06
--to pay restitution to Fort PD in the amount of $25
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--submit DNA sample upon demand

The Court orders:
--Revocation of Operating Privileges for 16 months
--Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel
--AODA assessment and follow through
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/ restrictions pursuant to 343.301(1g) for 16 months


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 10:43am

Cases 15CM365 and 15CT447 called together at 9:24am [mo]
Defendant Kari L Reed in court with Attorney Michael a Verrilli.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Verrilli requests a Plea and Sentencing date.
--no objection from DA Happ.

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 9:30am

NEXT: Plea and Sentencing on 3/7/16 at 10:00am

Cases 15CT447 & 15CM365 called at 8:59 am
Defendant Kari L Reed in court with Attorney Michael a Verrilli. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies DOB and address.
As to both cases:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $1000.00 signature bond, to cover both cases, with conditions: 
- Maintain absolute sobriety
-Not to possess or consume alcohol
- No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
- No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid d.l.
- Booking at JESO


Refund cash bond

Recess: 9:03 am 

NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 12/16/15 at 9:00 am
Status: 1/19/16 at 9:00 am
Information received with Bond Payment from Fort PD (at counter)
Copy of letter from FAPD to the defendant changing court date to 11-09-2015 at 8:30am
